title: After SC order, Basant Panchami, Friday prayers in separate areas of MP's Bhojshala today
content: The Supreme Court has expedited the Bhojshala Saraswati Temple cum Maulana Kamal Maula Mosque dispute. Both Hindu and Muslim communities can now offer prayers simultaneously in demarcated areas. The court has lifted its stay on the Madhya Pradesh High Court proceedings. The ASI report will be unsealed and shared with both sides.

title: Noida school evacuated after bomb threat, Ahmedabad also receive similar alerts
content: Shiv Nadar School in Noida was evacuated and closed following a bomb threat via email, with similar threats also received by schools in western Ahmedabad. Bomb disposal squads and police conducted searches, suspending classes as a precaution. Authorities are investigating the email's origin, and no explosives have been found.

title: After Tehran's 'finger on trigger’ salvo, Trump says 'massive US fleet' on way to Iran
content: The US is deploying an "armada" towards Iran, President Trump announced, as tensions escalate over Tehran's crackdown on protesters and its nuclear program.  While hoping the military show of force won't be necessary, Trump issued renewed warnings. Iran, meanwhile, asserts its readiness to retaliate against any US aggression, with both sides disputing protest death tolls amid an ongoing internet blackout.

title: Delhi-NCR wakes up to rain; AQI in ‘poor’ category at 297
content: Light rain and thunderstorms brought some relief to Delhi, improving air quality from the "very poor" to the "poor" category with an AQI of 297. This follows the revocation of Stage III GRAP measures due to an improving air quality trend. Further rain is expected to bring AQI to moderate levels by Saturday.

title: Davos debut: Elon Musk appears on stage for the first time; ‘I don’t think it’s such a bad future’
content: Elon Musk, at his World Economic Forum debut, revealed Tesla's Full Self-Driving system is nearing European and Chinese regulatory approval next month. He also announced plans to sell humanoid robots to the public by the end of next year, predicting AI models will surpass human intelligence within the same timeframe.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands of US employees
content: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization drive influenced by AI. The consulting giant aims to better align roles with evolving client demands and employee career aspirations. New senior leadership designations will also be introduced, promising greater clarity and market relevance across all divisions.

title: Happy Vasant Panchami 2026: Wishes messages, quotes, greetings and images to share
content: Vasant Panchami gently ushers in spring, celebrating Saraswati, the goddess of learning. This festival signifies new beginnings, encouraging personal reflection and the sharing of heartfelt messages. The article offers a collection of wishes, quotes, and image ideas to convey warmth, wisdom, and the quiet joy of this auspicious occasion.

title: 'Happy to save!' Trump thanks Chinese President Xi in first reaction to TikTok deal
content: Donald Trump celebrated a new deal for TikTok's US operations, now a majority American-owned joint venture, crediting himself for "saving" the platform. The agreement, which sees ByteDance retain a minority stake, aims to address national security concerns and avoid a ban for its 200 million American users.

title: Japan stocks surge with Toto and Kao hitting record highs
content: Apple executives are reportedly securing long-term memory supply deals with Samsung and SK Hynix amidst a global chip shortage. This crisis is boosting shares of memory manufacturers and even unrelated companies like Japanese toilet maker Toto, whose chipmaking materials operations are seeing unexpected growth due to AI infrastructure buildout.

title: Manipur horror: Meitei man abducted from Kuki fiancée’s house, killed on camera
content: A Meitei man visiting his Kuki fiancée in Churachandpur was abducted and shot dead on camera, sparking outrage and fresh tensions in Manipur. The victim, M Rishikanta, was found dead near Natjang village. The perpetrators' video message read "No Peace, No Popular Government." The case is now being handed over to the NIA for investigation.

title: ‘He was forced’: Manoj Tiwary's claim reignites debate over Kohli's Test exit
content: Former India batter Manoj Tiwary has sparked a debate, claiming Virat Kohli was "forced" to retire from Test cricket. Tiwary refuted suggestions that Kohli abandoned the toughest format for easier ones, asserting an atmosphere was created leading to his departure. Meanwhile, Kohli continues to shine in ODIs, recently scoring a century against New Zealand.

title: Oscars 2026: Vishal Jethwa reacts as ‘Homebound’ misses final cut
content: As "Homebound" failed to make it to the Oscars, actor Vishal Jethwa said that the film's journey remains extraordinary for him and added that being shortlisted among the final 15 films from 86 entries was itself a deeply humbling experience, especially given his modest beginnings.

title: OpenAI concerns: Google AI CEO on Sam Altman; ‘Maybe he’s realised what everyone is worried about’
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: ‘They didn’t ask’: Bangladesh cricketers reveal what happened in WC meeting
content: Bangladesh's participation in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 is in jeopardy as the national team refused to travel to India due to security concerns. Despite players' willingness to play, the government has decided against it, citing the ICC's failure to address their grievances. Scotland is reportedly being considered as a replacement.

title: Watch: Tourists trash Rs 500 Agra homestay, steal bulb from room; video goes viral
content: A viral video from Agra shows three young men trashing a hotel room, leaving it severely damaged and untidy.  Their actions, including jumping on beds with shoes on, have drawn widespread condemnation online.  Users are calling for better civic responsibility and accountability for such destructive behaviour in public accommodations, highlighting concerns over property damage.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50, BSE Sensex flat; earnings season in focus
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmarks, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened flat in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 was near 25,250, BSE Sensex was down 50 points. At 9:17 AM, Nifty50 was trading at 25,263.15, down 27 points or 0.11%.

title: Gracie Hunt hints at how she’s coping with Chiefs’ tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs’ billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has been a constant presence on the field as she has stayed by the team’s side through all the good and bad days. While the Kansas City Chiefs have had a pretty disappointing end in the ongoing season, the 26 year old billionaire heiress has hinted at how she has been coping with it.

title: Taylor Swift turns romance with Travis Kelce into new creative project: Report
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s romance has inspired billions around the world with the love, respect and commitment they have shown towards each other.While there have been reports that their high profile wedding might have been delayed, it seems Taylor Swift is already working on a new thing. To make it more interesting, her new project will be heavily inspired by her relationship with Travis Kelce.

title: Quote of the day: Patrick Mahomes on never losing hope in adverse times
content: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: Man quits high-paying job to become an auto driver
content: A former corporate employee, Rakesh Pal, left a high-paying job after facing manipulation, insecurity, and depression. He found his way back through weight loss and a modest gym trainer role, eventually buying an auto. Now, he drives for a living, prioritizing his well-being and happiness over a toxic corporate environment.

title: WPL: Sophie Devine stars! Gujarat Giants crush UP Warriorz by 45 runs
content: Sophie Devine's stellar all-round performance, featuring an unbeaten 50 and two wickets, powered Gujarat Giants to a dominant 45-run victory over UP Warriorz.  After posting 153/8, the Giants' disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Rajeshwari Gayakwad's three wickets, restricted UP to 108, ending a three-match losing streak and propelling Gujarat to second in the WPL standings.

title: Forced into marriage at 15, given triple-talaq twice: UP woman gang-raped under 'halala' pretence
content: A woman in Uttar Pradesh has accused her husband, relatives, and clerics of sexual violence and gang-rape under the guise of 'halala' after she was divorced via instant triple talaq. Police have invoked the 2019 triple talaq law, along with provisions for rape and other offenses. The case highlights the legal complexities surrounding Muslim personal law and marriageable age.

title: Piece or peace? Musk takes a jab at Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’
content: Elon Musk poked fun at Donald Trump's "Board of Peace," questioning if it was about "piece" of territory. Trump launched the board in Davos as part of his plan to end the Gaza war, with several nations joining. However, France and Slovenia declined, citing conflicts with international law and order.

title: ‘20 sleeping pills in biryani’: Woman murders husband, then watches porn
content: A woman allegedly murdered her husband with her boyfriend's help by drugging his biryani with sleeping pills. After he became unconscious, the boyfriend reportedly suffocated him with a pillow while the wife assisted. The wife then falsely claimed he died of a heart attack, but post-mortem revealed suffocation, leading to their arrest.

title: ‘Email not valid’: Kejriwal acquitted in ED summons case
content: A Delhi court has ruled that summons issued via email are not legally valid under CrPC or PMLA, acquitting Arvind Kejriwal for skipping Enforcement Directorate notices. The court found the ED failed to prove intentional disobedience, noting Kejriwal's status as a serving chief minister and his fundamental right to movement.

title: 'Your captain is Hindu': Ex-India cricketer warns Bangladesh over shifting T20 WC matches
content: Former cricketer Atul Wassan urged Bangladesh to resolve tensions with India regarding the T20 World Cup 2026, suggesting Litton Das's captaincy as a bridge. He dismissed the BCB's request to shift matches as logistically impossible and impractical, emphasizing India's robust security. The ICC confirmed matches will remain in India, despite the BCB's continued stance.

title: Srinagar snowfall disrupts flight services; IndiGo issues advisory
content: In an advisory to passengers, the airline said the suspension could lead to extended wait times, both onboard aircraft and at the airport, as weather conditions continued to affect operations. It added that boarding formalities may be completed in advance so that flights can depart immediately once clearance is granted.

title: MHA notifies Census 2027 schedule, lists 33 questions
content: India's upcoming Census 2027 will collect detailed household information, including building materials, amenities like water and sanitation, and ownership status. For the first time since 1931, caste details will be gathered. The houselisting and housing phase runs April-September 2026, with population enumeration in February 2027.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection day 49: Ranveer Singh starrer earns Rs 13.9 crore
content: 'Dhurandhar' starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna has completed its seventh week, achieving its lowest collection yet at Rs 1.1 crore but still surpassing Rs 1 crore. The film has set a new record for week 7 earnings, reaching a total of Rs 13.9 crore. Its impressive Rs 830.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for January 23 — check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends Gokaldas Exports, and Hindustan Unilever as stock picks for today. Here’s its view on Nifty and Bank Nifty:

title: A match made in open jail: Two life-term convicts to marry in Rajasthan
content: Two convicts serving life sentences for separate high-profile murder cases are set to marry after developing a relationship in Jaipur's open-air prison. Both Priya Seth and Hanuman Prasad were granted 15-day parole to facilitate their wedding in Alwar. The parole decision is facing opposition from the victim's family in Seth's case.

title: Lula discusses strategic ties with PM Modi, to visit in February
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will visit India from February 19-21 to strengthen the strategic partnership and discuss bilateral cooperation for the Global South. The leaders pledged to work together for UNSC reforms and peace in Gaza, with Lula also expected to attend the AI summit and a later BRICS summit.

title: 'Stop the World Cup': Pakistan urged to boycott T20 WC in support of Bangladesh
content: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif urged the PCB to boycott the T20 World Cup, supporting Bangladesh's security concerns. He believes Pakistan should challenge the cricket power structure by withdrawing, as their participation is crucial to the tournament's success. Latif questioned the ICC's dismissal of Bangladesh's relocation request, emphasizing the potential for sanctions but stressing the importance of taking a stand.

title: Patrick Mahomes questioned Travis Kelce’s Taylor Swift romance before seeing it
content: Patrick Mahomes revealed he initially doubted Travis Kelce’s relationship with Taylor Swift until she appeared at Arrowhead Stadium. ESPN’s The Kingdom showed locker room disbelief, massive fan buzz, and how Swift’s presence reshaped game day energy. Teammates admitted the attention was overwhelming, yet the Chiefs stayed focused and won.

title: Supreme Court rejects privacy plea, allows ED to access I-PAC man's phone
content: The Supreme Court refused to stop the ED from accessing information from an I-PAC functionary's seized mobile phone, despite pleas of privacy violation. The court stated it knows how to protect innocent citizens. This comes as ED faced interruptions in Kolkata during a search, unlike in Delhi.

title: Triple talaq-halala FIR puts focus on legal grey area
content: An FIR in UP details a woman's alleged gang-rape under the guise of 'halala' after an instant triple talaq. The law banning triple talaq has been invoked, alongside provisions for rape and other offenses. This case highlights the legal grey area surrounding halala, a practice not recognized by Indian statutory law.

title: T20 WC row: Bangladesh cite India's 'privilege'; accuse ICC of double standards
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board accuses ICC of double standards after its request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India was rejected. The BCB cited safety concerns, contrasting the ICC's past flexibility in allowing India to play the 2025 Champions Trophy at a neutral venue.

title: Missouri man sells a car to eight people on Facebook, then steals it back within 24 hours every time
content: A Kansas City man faces 14 felony counts for allegedly running a Facebook Marketplace scam, selling vehicles to multiple buyers and then stealing them back. Prosecutors say Mamadou Diallo used forged paperwork, convincing victims to pay thousands before the cars disappeared. The scheme reportedly occurred across at least eight sales in May and June 2025.

title: HC: Apart from refunds, how will you compensate flyers?
content: Delhi High Court has asked IndiGo to explain how it will compensate passengers affected by mass flight cancellations last December. The court noted that refunds are not the same as compensation. IndiGo is offering Rs 10,000 vouchers to some passengers. The court wants a detailed affidavit on compensation plans. Authorities have taken steps to prevent future disruptions.

title: Engineer shoots wife accidentally; distressed by death, he kills self
content: Tragedy struck in Ahmedabad as Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil's nephew, Yashrajsinh Gohil, allegedly shot his wife Rajeshwari accidentally with a licensed revolver.  Devastated by her death, he then reportedly took his own life. Police are investigating the incident, which occurred late Wednesday night in their apartment.

title: J&K: Armoured carrier skids off mountain road in Doda; 10 soldiers killed, 11 injured
content: Ten brave Army soldiers lost their lives and eleven were injured when their troop carrier veered off a treacherous mountain road in Doda, Jammu & Kashmir, plunging into a deep gorge. The vehicle was en route to a counterterrorism operation. This tragic incident highlights the persistent dangers faced by military personnel in the region's challenging terrain.

title: Nine fall ill due to water contamination in Mhow
content: Cases of water-borne diseases were reported from the Patti Bazaar and Chander Marg areas on Thursday (January 22, 2026) night, officials said

title: Tribals’ long march suspended after government accepts demands
content: Palghar District Collector Dr. Indu Rani Jakhar told The Hindu that the administration took review of the several concerns raised by the delegation

title: Light rains, thunderstorm across parts of Delhi; rain likely in Punjab and Haryana
content: IMD has predicted thunderstorms accompanied by rain over Delhi and adjoining regions for the day due to an ongoing western disturbance

title: Fadnavis refutes allegations of domestic MoUs being signed at Davos
content: Circular economy for Mumbai, India’s first Innovation city in the State, were some of the key announcements

title: Gujarat delegation holds over 30 global investor meetings at WEF 2026
content: Gujarat’s first delegation is engaging at the WEF to boost international collaboration, attract global investments, and advance its Viksit Gujarat@2047 development vision

title: Written 26 poems already on SIR: Mamata while inaugurating Kolkata Book Fair
content: Accuses Election Commission of harassing people over birth dates; says even Vajpayee was not born on December 25

title: The human cost behind every delivery
content: The Union government’s directive to quick-commerce platforms to drop the concept of 10-minute deliveries owing to the excessive stress it puts delivery personnel under has been welcomed by gig workers, but they say it is just the tip of the iceberg. Low pay, inadequate incentives, poor safety measures and mistreatment at work all threaten their livelihoods, writes Harish Gilai

title: 44 years on, closed dye factory’s contaminating colours still remain underground in Kochi
content: The unit produced Rhodamine-B, a fluorescent dye used mostly in textile, leather and cosmetics industries

title: Hesaraghatta Grassland: Is the grass greener with the new tag?
content: A year after the Hesaraghatta Grasslands got the conservation reserve tag, K.C. Deepika visits the area to see if there has been a transformation from ‘wasteland’ to a biodiversity hotspot

title: Auroral activity captured at Hanle by IIA’s all-sky camera
content: This is the sixth time during the current solar cycle that the intense red coloured auroral activity was captured by the all-sky camera

title: The Ponzi playbook in Telangana: built on trust, broken by fraud
content: Promising high returns and low risk, Ponzi schemes are quietly draining household savings across Telangana and beyond. Behind polished apps, corporate facades and reassuring payouts lies a carefully engineered cycle of trust, timing and collapse. Lavpreet Kaur examines how such frauds flourish amid regulatory gaps

title: India condemns incident of trespassing, vandalism at its embassy in Croatia
content: The MEA said it has taken up the matter “strongly” with Croatian authorities, both in New Delhi and in Zagreb and asked them to hold the perpetrators accountable for their “reprehensible” actions

title: IndiGo Delhi-Pune flight gets bomb threat; nothing suspicious found after thorough checks
content: Following the assessment, the aircraft was thoroughly checked by the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad, the official said, adding no suspicious or adverse findings were detected

title: How V.O. Chidambaram Pillai earned the title  ‘Sekkizhutha Chemmal’
content: VOC was arrested on the charge of sedition on March 12, 1908. A British jailer noticed his hands bleeding from the harsh labour of separating coir and spinning rope in the Coimbatore prison. Hence, he advised him to work at the oil press instead. VOC  accepted the suggestion and pulled the oil press himself, a task normally reserved for bulls

title: When E.V.K. Sampath hit the headlines in Tamil Nadu
content: Sampath, nephew of E.V. Ramasamy, enjoyed a special relationship with DMK founder C.N. Annadurai. Before other DMK leaders, he realised the futility of pursuing the demand for a Dravida Nadu. He quit the DMK in 1961 and founded a party, which he merged with the Congress. Sampath’s birth centenary falls on March 6, 2026.

title: Vadasery’s temple jewellery: a craft caught between heritage and high gold, silver prices
content: Temple jewellery continues to survive with its distinctive manufacturing method and rich antiquity. But the artisans of Vadasery in Nagercoil, who practise the craft, are buffeted by the drop in demand with gold and silver prices going up

title: A natural heater hidden in India’s ‘sacred lotus’ flowers
content: When these pretty flowers bloom for three to four days, their internal temperature is around 30-35º C even as the surrounding temperature can go down to 10º C

title: Killed for a cow: A mob lynching in Odisha and deepening mistrust between communities
content: On January 14, a man was beaten to death in Odisha’s Balasore district on suspicion of his involvement in what is now being called cattle trafficking by the police. Satyasundar Barik visits the family to piece together the events of that day, and examine how cattle trading is emerging as a flashpoint, deepening mistrust between majority and minority communities

title: Uttarakhand Congress MLA's son staged own attack; absconds after revelation
content: Three masked assailants on a two-wheeler allegedly attacked Mr. Raj with sticks and rods, seriously injuring him. He was admitted to the ICU for several hours

title: Education Ministry sets up three-member team to review cases of student suicides at IIT-Kanpur
content: Two students have ended their lives at IIT-Kanpur within the past month, prompting the government to set up the committee

title: India’s reform momentum is firmly on track: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Union Minister says landmark reforms undertaken in the past few years, such as labour code reforms and simplification of the Goods and Services Tax, are generating strong investor confidence across sectors

title: Stalin launches Sprint 1; now, register properties without visiting Sub Registrar’s office
content: While ‘paperless registration’ is now available for all 30 deed types, ‘presenceless registration ’is available for 10 types of documents including sale deeds, sale agreements, and lease deeds

title: Court acquits Sajjan Kumar in 1984 anti-Sikh riots case
content: Prosecution failed to prove guilt beyond reasonable doubt, says court; case relates to an FIR over killing of two men in Janakpuri on November 1, 1984; victims’ kin call the acquittal an ‘injustice’

title: Tariffs imposed by President Trump punitive, counterproductive for the US: Matt Winkler
content: Referring to its impact on India, he said the country faced the biggest five-month export decline since 1960 between April and August 2025

title: Government asks airlines to submit requests for IndiGo’s vacated slots
content: Following massive disruptions, DGCA reduced IndiGo's winter schedule by 10%, which meant the airline had stopped operating services in various slots

title: Kerala Literature Festival gets under way
content: American astronaut Sunita Williams and Tourism Minister jointly inaugurate the four-day festival, which will conclude on January 25, 2026

title: Kerala secures investment commitments worth $14 billion at Davos
content: These proposals range across sectors — renewable energy, GCC, skill development, financial services, tourism, wellness, medical infrastructure, and medical device manufacturing

title: Startup revolution key to growth in space technology, says NRSC Director
content: Observation of earth, communication and navigation satellites are critical for agriculture, disaster management, climate monitoring, transport and digital services, says Dr. Prakash Chauhan

title: Woman, paramour held for ‘murdering’ husband in Guntur district
content: The woman allegedly served her husband biryani laced with sleeping pills before smothering him with a pillow, say police

title: Command control centre at Dr. NTRUHS to monitor exams in A.P. medical colleges
content: Authorities can monitor the examinations at 37 medical colleges in the State from this facility, says Health Minister

title: PM Modi speaks to Brazil's Lula, says ties key for interests of Global South
content: The two leaders reaffirmed their commitment to further strengthen the India-Brazil Strategic Partnership and take it to even greater heights in the year ahead, the statement said

title: Census 2027 first phase to have 33 questions
content: The questions include Census house number, material of floor of the house, whether the head of the household belongs to a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe, main source of drinking water, and access to toilet

title: A.P., Telangana discuss student development initiatives
content: APSCHE Chairman K. Madhu Murthy and TGCHE Chairman V. Balakista Reddy discuss promoting research and innovation and fostering institutional partnerships

title: Portal to regularise violation of land use norms operational: Minister
content: Minister for Revenue K. Rajan said people could apply through the www.klarc.kerala.gov.in portal from Friday.

title: Eknath Shinde should support Uddhav Thackeray in BMC, says Sena (UBT) leader
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) has 65 seats in BMC. Eknath Shinde has 29 seats. The magic figure for power in BMC is 114.

title: At global meet, CEC Gyanesh Kumar offers ECINet model to help fight election misinformation
content: On the second day of the International Conference on Democracy and Election Management, Gyanesh Kumar noted that the heads of various poll management bodies had shared their concerns during the conference on the threat of misinformation to democracy

title: Interfaith couple hacked to death in Moradabad
content: The woman’s brothers were opposed to the interfaith relationship, and confessed to killing the couple

title: Karnataka Cabinet allows five-year age relaxation for Karnataka Civil Services exams
content: Sources said that the decision was taken since public recruitment has been affected owing to several reasons, including over the issue of internal reservation for Scheduled Castes

title: PM Modi to launch development projects in Thiruvananthapuram city on  Friday
content: Projects span key sectors, including rail connectivity, urban livelihoods, science and innovation, citizen-centric services, and advanced health-care

title: Why ‘illegal immigration’ was not cited as reason for SIR, Supreme Court asks EC
content: SC says poll body seemed to been referring more to inter-State migration and not cross-border illegal movement to conduct the SIR; verification of citizenship was not needed if an elector had moved from one State to another

title: India absent as Trump rolls out his Board of Peace with 19 countries in attendance
content: The U.S. President’s attempt to create momentum for a project to map out a future of the war-torn Gaza Strip has been overshadowed this week, first by his threats to seize Greenland, then by a dramatic retreat from that push

title: Centre permits State to procure 1.01 lakh tonnes of Bengal gram
content: Union Minister for Agriculture Shivraj Singh Chouhan asccuses State government of failing to meet procurement targets of toor dal and tothapuri mango

title: Congress high command asks Punjab leaders to refrain from speaking publicly on party’s internal issues
content: Indiscipline and groupism will not be tolerated, the party says, adding it’s committed to providing due representation to marginalised sections

title: CPI(M) demands increase in rearing cost of broiler chicken
content: He calls for the government to convene a meeting of broiler chicken farmers, poultry companies, and the Animal Husbandry Department

title: Prayagraj mela authorities serve fresh notice on seer Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati
content: Authorities accuse Swami Avimukteshwaranand of breaking a bridge barrier, using a chariot without permission, and creating law-and-order problems; threaten to cancel his land allotment, bar him from mela

title: SCR seeks rationalisation of power tariff in A.P. to ease burden on Railways
content: Traction tariff is higher by up to ₹3.40 per unit in the State compared to the charges in 14 other States, says railway official at APERC’s public hearing

title: Congress MP’s nephew ‘kills wife in accidental firing, then shoots himself’
content: Police said that after she was declared dead, Yashrajsinh, unable to bear the shock, shot himself with the same firearm while his mother and the medics watched

title: ED attaches ₹20.85 crore worth properties in MUDA case in Karnataka
content: The attached assets include six illegally allotted MUDA sites, three immovable properties, and one commercial building

title: DRDO to showcase hypersonic missile, advanced submarine technologies on Republic Day
content: The Long Range Anti-Ship Hypersonic Missile (LR-AShM), a first-of-its-kind system, features fully indigenous avionics and advanced sensor packages, underscoring India’s self-reliance, the Union Ministry of Defence states

title: Madras High Court to hear cash-for-jobs case against Minister K.N. Nehru on January 23
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan would be hearing the writ petition filed by AIADMK MP I.S. Inbadurai

title: Union Finance Minister Sitharaman assures to review tax hike on unmanufactured tobacco
content: A delegation of Flue-Cured Virginia tobacco farmers meets the Union Finance Minister and expresses concern over the adverse impact of 18% hike on farmers and regulated FCV tobacco ecosystem

title: Higher Education Minister boycotts Madras University convocation
content: Citing Governor R.N. Ravi’s actions, he says the Governor has no right to award degrees; over 1.9 lakh students receive degrees

title: Nicobar Tribal Council says it is being pressured to sign ‘surrender certificate’ for ancestral tribal lands
content: The Great Nicobar Island mega project includes forest lands where the Nicobarese lived before the 2004 tsunami; “It is our ancestral tribal land. We will have nothing for the future generations,” says Council member

title: Govt. medical college teachers’ forum to intensify protest
content: KGMCTA holds dharna and protest meetings in all government medical colleges and in front of Directorate of Medical Education office

title: Andhra Pradesh emerging as a hub for technology, investment and innovation, says Lokesh in Davos
content: Appeals to  Accenture to establish a Global Delivery Centre in Visakhapatnam, announces that Andhra Pradesh will host South Asia’s most powerful quantum computer by July 2026

title: Over 20,000 private schools in Karnataka have violated norms, did not get recognition renewal
content: Government moves to relax four key rules, including submission of land conversion documents, to facilitate RR renewal of schools.

title: Jagan spreading lies on land reforms, says Revenue Minister Satya Prasad
content: Drawing a comparison between the passbooks brought out by the YSRCP government and the ones introduced by the NDA dispensation, he says the revised passbooks have the State emblem and over 15 security features

title: Ravens hiring Bolts' Minter as new head coach
content: The Ravens are hiring Los Angeles Chargers defensive coordinator Jesse Minter as their next head coach, the team announced Thursday.

title: Colts confirm FBI opened probe into Irsay's death
content: The Indianapolis Colts on Thursday acknowledged the existence of an FBI investigation into the death of owner Jim Irsay and the potential involvement of a California doctor who reportedly prescribed him pain pills and ketamine.

title: Kuminga leaves early after injuring ankle, knee
content: The Warriors' Jonathan Kuminga had a strong start Thursday against the Mavs before his night was cut short because of a twisted ankle and knee hyperextension at the end of the first half.

title: No. 16 Sooners take down No. 2 Gamecocks in OT
content: Aaliyah Chavez scored 15 of her 26 points in overtime, and No. 16 Oklahoma stunned No. 2 South Carolina 94-82 on Thursday night.

title: Rodman contract saga ends with record Spirit deal
content: United States forward Trinity Rodman signed a record three-year contract with the Washington Spirit on Thursday to remain at the club, ending months-long uncertainty over the star's future.

title: Moore returns to court, wants charges dismissed
content: Ex-Michigan coach Sherrone Moore returned to court, with his lawyer saying he's seeking to have home invasion and other charges against him dismissed.

title: Lawyer suing NFLPA for retaliation fired by union
content: Attorney Heather McPhee says the union wanted to keep her from cooperating with a federal inquiry into NFLPA finances.

title: Nationals send Gore to Rangers in 5-for-1 trade
content: The Rangers have acquired All-Star left-hander MacKenzie Gore from the Nationals in exchange for five prospects, including Gavin Fien, the 12th pick in the draft.

title: 🏈 NFL mock draft: Kiper projects the first round
content: Where will national title game standouts Fernando Mendoza and Akheem Mesidor land in Round 1? And could we really see six WRs in the opening 32 picks?

title: Follow live: Medvedev completes remarkable comeback, Osaka apologizes for 'disrespectful' comments
content: Third round singles action begins at the Australian Open on Friday with world No. 1s Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka, as well as American star Coco Gauff, highlighting the day session.

title: Who were the most valuable players in the NFL this season? Let's stack the top 100
content: We took the MVP conversation beyond Drake Maye vs. Matthew Stafford ... way beyond. Here are the 100 top players of the 2025 season.

title: SIR order makes no mention of citizenship verification: SC to EC
content: EC's counsel said the order did not state that verification of citizenship was one of the reasons for conducting the exercise . a bench of chief justice Surya Kant and justice Joymalya Bagchi said the exercise was also about illegal immigration .

title: TikTok to avoid US ban: Majority American-led joint venture formed with Chinese ownership
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: 9 Hospitalised After Drinking Contaminated Water In Mhow's Madhya Pradesh
content: At least nine people have fallen ill after consuming contaminated drinking water in Mhow tehsil of Madhya Pradesh's Indore district, officials said on Friday.

title: Trump Claims Credit As TikTok Reaches Deal To Continue Operating In US
content: TikTok announced Thursday it has established a majority American-owned joint venture to operate its US business, allowing the company to avoid a ban over its Chinese ownership.

title: BJP's 5 Frontrunners For Mumbai Mayor's Post After Mega BMC Victory
content: After the BJP-led alliance's grand victory in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections, all eyes are on the mayoral poll.

title: Trump Withdraws Invitation To Mark Carney To Join Board Of Peace
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday withdrew an invite for Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney to join his newly constituted "Board of Peace."

title: Andhra Woman Fed Husband Biryani, Then Smothered Him With Lover's Help
content: Initial reports claimed that Madhuri watched porn videos beside her husband's body. However, the police later said it was the victim who used to watch such content on her phone.

title: Rain In Delhi, Snowfall In Kashmir As North India Sees Weather Shift
content: IMD Weather Updates: Light to moderate rain was witnessed across several parts of Delhi, accompanied by rumbling thunderstorms, lightning, and strong winds, this morning. The weather body said cloudy conditions are likely to continue through the day

title: Gangster Ravi Pujari Arrested In 2018 Remo D'Souza Extortion Case
content: Gangster Ravi Pujari has been arrested in a 2018 extortion case involving Bollywood choreographer Remo D'Souza and his wife Lizelle D'Souza.

title: US Immigration Agents Detain 5-Year-Old, School Claims He Was Used As 'Bait'
content: A 5-year-old boy arriving home from preschool in Minnesota was taken by federal agents along with his father to a detention facility in Texas, school officials and the family's lawyer said

title: "Bangladesh Now Ruled By Fanatics": Ex-Minister Jabs Muhammad Yunus
content: Former Foreign Minister Hasan Mahmud has launched a blistering attack on the interim government led by Muhammad Yunus, accusing it of presiding over what he called an "arranged election", enabling the rise of fanatic and militant forces,

title: PM Modi Pays Tributes To Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose On Birth Anniversary
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday paid glowing tributes to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his birth anniversary, saying he epitomised fearless leadership and unwavering patriotism.

title: "His Vision For Maharashtra Inspires Us": PM Modi's tribute to Balasaheb Thackeray
content: PM Modi paid a heartfelt tribute to Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray on his birth centenary, stating that his vision for Maharashtra's progress continues to inspire generations and that efforts will always be made to realise his ideals.

title: "He Is Just A Baby": Kamala Harris vs Team Trump Over 5-Year-Old's Detention
content: The Ecuadorean boy and his father have been living in the US legally as asylum applicants, an attorney representing the family told the news agency Reuters.

title: "Always Had Great Relationship" With Xi Jinping: Trump Confirms China Visit
content: US President Donald Trump said that he plans to travel to China in April and host Chinese President Xi Jinping in the United States later this year, signaling renewed leader-level engagement between the two countries.

title: Trump Says "Big Force" Heading Toward Iran, US "Watching Closely"
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday a US naval "armada" was heading toward the Gulf, maintaining pressure on Iran although he has recently downplayed the prospect of imminent military action.

title: Denmark Considering Building Small Nuclear Reactors, Lifting Of 1985 Nuke Ban
content: Denmark is considering building small modular nuclear reactors to meet its energy needs, the climate and energy ministry said Thursday, which would bring an end to its 1985 ban on nuclear power.

title: Trump Says Will Sue New York Times Over Unfavorable Opinion Poll
content: US President Donald Trump announced Thursday he will sue The New York Times for publishing an opinion poll that found steadily sliding support from voters for the Republican right-winger.

title: Top Maoist With Bounty Of Rs 1 Crore Killed In Jharkhand: Amit Shah
content: Union Minister Amit Shah said that in West Singhbhum, the ongoing joint operation by CRPF and Jharkhand Police has achieved a major success in the campaign to make the region free of Naxals through encounters.

title: Amazon Plans To Lay Off 14,000 Employees By Next Week: Report
content: Amazon is planning a second round of job cuts next week as part of its broader goal of trimming some 30,000 corporate workers, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: French Navy Boards Tanker 'From Russia' In Mediterranean: Macron
content: France's navy, with the help of allies, on Thursday boarded a tanker alleged to be from Russia's sanction-busting "shadow fleet" in the Mediterranean, President Emmanuel Macron said.

title: MK Stalin Seeks Amendment To Scrap Governor's Address In Assembly
content: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin said that the DMK would consult like-minded opposition parties across the country to move a constitutional amendment abolishing the practice of the Governor's address at the start of the first session of state Assemblies.

title: 'Heated Rivalry' stars named torchbearers for Milan Cortina Olympics
content: MILAN -- The actors co-starring in the hit hockey romance TV series "Heated Rivalry" are set to be among the torchbearers carrying the Olympic flame on the way to the Opening Ceremony for the Milan Cortina Games. The organizing committee announced Thursday that Hudson Williams and Connor Storrie will take part in the torch relay. The Opening Ceremony is scheduled for Feb. 6. The series based on the "Game Changers" books has captivated viewers with the fictional story of a Canadian player and a Russian rival sustaining a decade-long secret relationship. The first season became the No. 1 series on HBO Max. Originally developed for the Canadian streaming service Crave, the show scored a distribution deal with HBO and has been renewed for a second season. It will broadcast in Italy beginning next month.
